title: is FF Unit suitable for signage?
content:
is FF Unit realy suitable for signage systems? it was designed for that purpose but obviously it doesn’t have (all) characters for some countries like ex-yugoslav republics for example.

now it’s available in three versions: Unit 1, 2 and 3 but i still haven’t found which one is suitable for signage. maybe you know a better signage typeface?

 [‹ Need help with script font suggestions](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122111730/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48531 "Go to previous forum topic") [Stone Sans, Serif, and Informal ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122111730/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48471 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ghurman

comments.content: FF Unit is a fine face for signage — compact but very open and legible. [FF Unit Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122111730/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_unit_complete_collection_pro/) contains all Central European character sets and should support the languages you need, including Bosnian, Croatian, Slovenian, and Sorbian. See the [specimen PDF](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122111730/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/download.php?docid=289).

<cite>doesn’t have (all) characters for some countries like ex-yugoslav republics</cite>

That is, FF Unit doesn’t [support Cyrillic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122111730/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/opentype-fontfonts-and-the-languages-they-speak/) (yet?), right? Macedonian and Serbian use Cyrillic, afaik.

True. If Jedan needs Cyrillic, I can recommend [FF Meta](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122111730/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_meta_pro_1/), [FF Daxline](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122111730/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_daxline_pro/), [FF Good](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122111730/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_good_pro/), [FF Kievit](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122111730/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_kievit_1_pro/), or Lucas de Groot’s [Corpid III](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122111730/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/lucasfonts/corpid_e1s/).

no cyrillic needed. the problem is that ff unit doesn’t have all 5 diacritic characters of the ex-yu languages.

now, i suppose Unit Pro version does have them all but the OT version doesn’t?
That is correct. Have a look at the PDFs or the Character Set on any Single Font page for a look at the complete contents.
